EnablingAuthority.XRefExternal: FIRST NATIONS COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT ACT

Provision.Text: Whereas, in accordance with paragraph 5(1)(a) of the First Nations Commercial and Industrial Development Acta, the Minister of Indigenous Services has received a resolution from the council of the Squamish Nation requesting that the Minister recommend to the Governor in Council the making of the annexed Regulations;

Whereas the purpose of the annexed Regulations is to ensure that the laws set out in Schedule 2 to the annexed Regulations apply as federal law to the project lands, within the limits of federal constitutional authority;

Whereas, in accordance with paragraph 3(2)(b) of that Act, the annexed Regulations confer on the Minister of Indigenous Services the legislative power that the Governor in Council considers necessary to effectively regulate the commercial or industrial undertakings that are located on the reserve lands described in the annexed Regulations;
Whereas the annexed Regulations specify provincial officials by whom, and provincial bodies by which, powers may be exercised or duties are to be performed;

And whereas, in accordance with paragraph 5(1)(b) of that Act, an agreement has been concluded between the Minister of Indigenous Services, the Province of British Columbia and the council of the Squamish Nation for the administration and enforcement of the annexed Regulations by those provincial officials and provincial bodies;

Therefore, Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Indigenous Services makes the annexed Squamish Nation Residential Tenancy Regulations under sections 3b and 4 of the First Nations Commercial and Industrial Development Acta.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: First Nation, in relation to lands described in column 2 of Schedule 1, means the First Nation named in column 1 of that Schedule. (Première Nation)

incorporated laws means the statutes and regulations of British Columbia, or the portions of them, that are set out in Schedule 2, as amended from time to time and as adapted by sections 11 to 31. (texte législatif incorporé)
project lands, in relation to a First Nation named in column 1 of Schedule 1, means the reserve lands described in column 2 of that Schedule. (terres du projet)
provincial body has the same meaning as in section 1 of the FNCIDA Implementation Act, S.B.C. 2012, c. 21. (organisme provincial)
provincial official has the same meaning as in section 1 of the FNCIDA Implementation Act, S.B.C. 2012, c. 21. (fonctionnaire provincial)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of the First Nations Commercial and Industrial Development Act, the meaning of the expression “commercial or industrial undertaking” is enlarged to include a manufactured home park and a residential tenancy development.

Section.Text: The incorporated laws are to be interpreted in accordance with the British Columbia Interpretation Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 238, as amended from time to time, and, for that purpose, references to “enactment” in that Act are to be read to include the incorporated laws.
For greater certainty, the adaptations in sections 11 to 31 are to be interpreted to be part of the incorporated laws to which they apply.

The purpose of these Regulations is to implement with respect to the project lands a legal regime that is harmonized with the legal regime of British Columbia that governs the landlord and tenant relationship in relation to manufactured home parks and residential tenancy developments.

Section.MarginalNote: Power to fix date of application
Section.Text: Subject to sections 6 and 9, the Minister must, by order, fix and set out in column 3 of Schedule 1, the date on which the incorporated laws begin to apply to project lands listed in column 2 of that Schedule.

Subsection.Text: A provision of an incorporated law applies only if the provision of the law of British Columbia that it incorporates is in force.
For greater certainty, an incorporated law applies only to the extent that it is within the limits of federal constitutional authority.

Section.Text: If contravention of a law of British Columbia that is incorporated in these Regulations is an offence under the laws of British Columbia, contravention of the incorporated law is also an offence and is subject to the same penalties as under the laws of British Columbia.

Subsection.Text: Unless otherwise provided and subject to any adaptations set out in sections 11 to 31, the following are to conform to the laws of British Columbia, whether or not those laws have been set out in Schedule 2:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the enforcement of incorporated laws;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the prosecution of an offence, or any other proceedings, in relation to the contravention of an incorporated law;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the review or appeal of an action or decision taken, or of a failure to take an action that could have been taken, under an incorporated law; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any requirements for notice or other procedures in relation to an action to be taken under an incorporated law.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person, provincial official or provincial body that has a power, duty or function under a law of British Columbia is a person, provincial official or provincial body specified to have the same power, duty or function in respect of any actions taken under that subsection.

Section.MarginalNote: Notice to leaseholders and Indians in lawful possession

Subsection.Text: Before the Minister makes an order under section 5 with respect to any project lands, the council of the First Nation must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: send notice by mail to the following persons registered as leaseholders or Indians in lawful possession, as applicable, in a register in which the project lands are registered, at the addresses that are indicated in relation to the registrations or that may be otherwise known by the First Nation, advising those leaseholders and Indians of the intention to apply the incorporated laws to the project lands:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any leaseholder in any of the project lands, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any Indian considered to be lawfully in possession of any of the lands under section 20 of the Indian Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: publish a notice one day per week for two consecutive weeks, in the local newspaper with the largest circulation, advising of the intention to apply the incorporated laws to the project lands; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: provide the Minister with written notice of compliance with paragraphs (a) and (b).

Subsection.MarginalNote: No invalidity or cause of action
Subsection.Text: An order made by the Minister under section 5 is not invalid by reason only of the failure of a leaseholder or Indian referred to in paragraph (1)(a) to receive notice under subsection (1) and no cause of action exists against His Majesty in right of Canada, the Minister, His Majesty in right of British Columbia, any provincial official, any provincial body, the First Nation or the council of the First Nation from such a failure.
In this section, Indian has the same meaning as in subsection 2(1) of the Indian Act.

Section.Text: Once the incorporated laws apply to the project lands, the officer in the Department of Indigenous Services responsible for the management of the register in which those project lands are registered must place a notation on the register indicating that the incorporated laws apply to those project lands.

Section.MarginalNote: Statutes and regulations of British Columbia
Section.Text: Unless otherwise indicated, the statutes and regulations referred to in sections 16 to 31 are statutes and regulations of British Columbia.
A reference to a “person” in an incorporated law is to be read to include a First Nation.

Subsection.Text: Incorporated laws are to be read without reference to any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: spent provisions, commencement provisions and consequential amendments;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provisions appointing a person; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: provisions authorizing the Lieutenant Governor in Council to make regulations of general application, except to the extent required to make the regulations set out in Schedule 2.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(b), a person who is appointed to a position under an incorporated law is considered to have been appointed to the same position for the purposes of these Regulations for as long as that person remains in that position under the law of British Columbia.

For greater certainty, a person, provincial official or provincial body that has a power, duty or function under an incorporated law or a law of British Columbia referred to in subsection 8(1) that is not set out in Schedule 2, is a person specified to have the same power, duty or function under these Regulations, subject to the adaptations set out in sections 16 to 31.

For greater certainty, if a law is adapted by these Regulations, a reference to that law in an incorporated law, or in any notice, form, instrument or other document issued under an incorporated law, is to be read as a reference to that law as adapted by these Regulations.

Section.Text: A provision of an incorporated law that imposes an obligation, liability or penalty on a landlord, owner, occupier, public authority, public body or unspecified person or entity does not apply to His Majesty in right of Canada or federal ministers or officials.

Section.MarginalNote: Power to seize, remove or compel production of documents
Section.Text: A power to seize or remove a document or record or to compel the production of a document or record under an incorporated law does not include a power to seize or remove a document or record that is in the possession of the federal government or to compel the production by the federal government of a document or record.
Section 10.1 of the Emergency Program Act is adapted by adding the following after subsection (8):

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of the Canadian federal Regulations entitled Squamish Nation Residential Tenancy Regulations, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make a regulation under subsection (1) or (2) only in respect of tenancies under the Manufactured Home Park Tenancy Act and the Residential Tenancy Act.

Section.Text: The Manufactured Home Park Tenancy Act is adapted by adding the following after section 12:

The landlord of a manufactured home site that exists on the day on which, under the Canadian federal Regulations entitled Squamish Nation Residential Tenancy Regulations, the incorporated laws apply to the project lands where the manufactured home site is situated must, within 15 days after that day, provide written notice to the tenant of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicability of the Squamish Nation Residential Tenancy Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the leasehold interest in the manufactured home site granted by His Majesty ends;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the possibility that the leasehold interest may be cancelled before the date on which it ends;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the fact that the tenancy cannot continue beyond the date on which the leasehold interest in the manufactured home site granted by His Majesty ends and, if applicable, beyond the date of an early cancellation; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the fact that the obligations, liabilities and penalties imposed on a landlord under this Act and its regulations do not apply to His Majesty, His Ministers or any federal official.

Subsection.Text: Subsection 13(1) of the Act is to be read as follows:

A landlord must prepare in writing every tenancy agreement entered into on or after the day on which, under the Canadian federal Regulations entitled Squamish Nation Residential Tenancy Regulations, the incorporated laws apply to the project lands where the manufactured home site is situated.
Subsection 13(2) of that Act is adapted by adding the following after paragraph (g):

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: notice of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the applicability of the Canadian federal Regulations entitled Squamish Nation Residential Tenancy Regulations;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the leasehold interest in the manufactured home site granted by His Majesty ends;

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the possibility that the leasehold interest may be cancelled before the date on it ends;

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the fact that the tenancy cannot continue beyond the date on which the leasehold interest in the manufactured home site granted by His Majesty ends and, if applicable, beyond the date of an early cancellation; and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the fact that the obligations, liabilities and penalties imposed on a landlord under this Act and its regulations do not apply to His Majesty, His Ministers or any federal official.

Section.Text: Subsection 37(1) of the Act is adapted by adding the following after paragraph (g):

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: if His Majesty granted a leasehold interest in the manufactured home site, when the leasehold ends.

Section.Text: The Act is adapted by adding the following after section 37:

If His Majesty is the lessor of the landlord’s leasehold interest in the manufactured home site, the landlord must, at least two years and again at least six months before the end date, provide written notice to the tenant

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: of the end date of that leasehold interest; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: of the fact that, after the end date, this Act and the regulations do not apply to His Majesty and the tenancy.

Section.Text: Paragraph 40(1)(j) of the Act is to be read as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the manufactured home site must be vacated to comply with an order of a federal, British Columbia or First Nation government authority;

Section.MarginalNote: Adaptation to subsection 32(1) — definition of local government levies

Subsection.Text: The definition local government levies in subsection 32(1) of the Manufactured Home Park Tenancy Regulation is to be read without reference to “and” at the end of paragraph (a), with reference to “and” at the end of paragraph (b) and with reference to the following after paragraph (b):

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: fees paid to a First Nation for similar purposes to those for which fees may be payable under section 194 of the Community Charter;

Subsection.MarginalNote: Adaptation to subsection 32(1) — definition of utility fees
Subsection.Text: The definition utility fees in subsection 32(1) of the Regulation is adapted by adding the following after paragraph (d):

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a First Nation.

Section.Text: A reference to “January 1, 2004” in the Residential Tenancy Act is to be read as a reference to “the date on which, under the Canadian federal Regulations entitled Squamish Nation Residential Tenancy Regulations, the incorporated laws apply to the project lands where the rental unit is situated”.
The Act is adapted by adding the following after section 12:

The landlord of a rental unit that exists on the day on which, under the Canadian federal Regulations entitled Squamish Nation Residential Tenancy Regulations, the incorporated laws apply to the project lands where the rental unit is situated must, within 15 days after that day, provide written notice to the tenant of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicability of the Squamish Nation Residential Tenancy Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the leasehold interest in the rental unit granted by His Majesty ends;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if applicable, the possibility that the leasehold interest may be cancelled before the date on which it ends;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the fact that the tenancy cannot continue beyond the date on which the leasehold interest in the rental unit granted by His Majesty ends and, if applicable, beyond the date of an early cancellation; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the fact that the obligations, liabilities and penalties imposed on a landlord under this Act and its regulations do not apply to His Majesty, His Ministers or any federal official.

Section.Text: Subsection 13(2) of the Act is adapted by adding the following after paragraph (f):

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: notice of the following:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the applicability of the Canadian federal Regulations entitled Squamish Nation Residential Tenancy Regulations;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the date on which the leasehold interest in the rental unit granted by His Majesty ends;

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if applicable, the possibility that the leasehold interest may be cancelled before it ends;

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the fact that the tenancy cannot continue beyond the date on which the leasehold interest in the rental unit granted by His Majesty ends and, if applicable, beyond the date of an early cancellation; and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the fact that the obligations, liabilities and penalties imposed on a landlord under this Act and its regulations do not apply to His Majesty, His Ministers or any federal official.

Section.Text: Subsection 44(1) of the Act is adapted by adding the following after paragraph (g):

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: His Majesty granted a leasehold interest in the rental unit, when the leasehold ends.

Section.Text: The Act is adapted by adding the following after section 44:

If His Majesty is the lessor of the landlord’s leasehold interest in the rental unit, the landlord must, at least two years and again at least six months before the end date, provide written notice to the tenant

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: of the end date of that leasehold interest; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: of the fact that, after the end date, this Act and the regulations do not apply to His Majesty and the tenancy.

Section.Text: Paragraph 47(1)(k) of the Act is to be read as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the rental unit must be vacated to comply with an order of a federal, British Columbia or First Nation government authority;

Section.Text: Paragraph 1(2)(b) of the Residential Tenancy Regulation is to be read as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by a person or organization that receives funding from a First Nation, a local government or the government of British Columbia or of Canada for the purpose of providing that accommodation, and

Subsection.Text: The portion of paragraph 2(g) of the Regulation before subparagraph (i) is to be read as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: any housing society or non-profit municipal or First Nation housing corporation that has an agreement regarding the operation of residential property with the following:

Subsection.Text: Subparagraph 2(g)(iv) of the Regulation is to be read as follows:

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a municipality or a First Nation;

Subsection.Text: Paragraph 2(h) of the Regulation is to be read as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: any housing society or non-profit municipal or First Nation housing corporation that previously had an agreement regarding the operation of residential property with a person or body listed in paragraph (g), if the agreement expired and was not renewed.

Section.Text: Paragraph 39(c) of the Regulation is to be read as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a member of the provincial police force or a municipal or First Nation police department in British Columbia;

Section.Text: The Minister may, at the request of the council of the First Nation named in column 1 of Schedule 1, amend by order column 2 of that Schedule to add or delete project lands or to modify the description of project lands.
These Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.
